actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to amend title 18, United States Code, to modify the exception to the prohibition on the interception of wire, oral, or electronic communications to require a health insurance issuer, health plan, or health care provider obtain an enrollee's or patient's consent to their interception, and for other purposes.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues
Federal aid to child health services

summary.text: Patients' Telephone Privacy Act of 1999 - Amends the Federal criminal code to allow a health insurance issuer, health plan, or health care provider, with respect to a wire, oral, or electronic communication between a health insurance issuer or health plan and an enrollee of such issuer or plan, or between a health care provider and a patient, to intercept such communication only if the patient has given prior express consent. Requires such an issuer, plan, or provider that notifies a customer of its intent to record or monitor any communication with such customer to provide the customer with the option to conduct the communication without being recorded or monitored.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 18, United States Code, to modify the exception to the prohibition on the interception of wire, oral, or electronic communications to require a health insurance issuer, health plan, or health care provider obtain an enrollee's or patient's consent to their interception, and for other purposes.
